https://prez.dev/description.@value: Methods used to spatially locate geological features and exploration, mining and related infrastructure sites. These can be either features directly observed in the field (e.g. site/outcrop descriptions, structural readings, etc.) or obtained from legacy and current documents/datasets (e.g. airphotos, maps, previously published reports, exploration reports, etc.). Each location method has a spatial accuracy that indicates an estimate of the approximate error in the location. Captured geographical locations for geological or mining features are expressed as a set of coordinates (latitude and longitude degrees), with or without an elevation above or below sea level.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A total station (TS) or total station theodolite (TST) is an electronic/optical instrument used for surveying and building construction. It is an electronic transit theodolite integrated with electronic distance measurement (EDM) to measure both vertical and horizontal angles and the slope distance from the instrument to a particular point, and an on-board computer to collect data and perform triangulation calculations.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Used in the mineral resources exploration and mining industry, and captured by GSWA via mineral exploration reports.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A total station (TS) or total station theodolite (TST) is an electronic/optical instrument used for surveying and building construction. It is an electronic transit theodolite integrated with electronic distance measurement (EDM) to measure both vertical and horizontal angles and the slope distance from the instrument to a particular point, and an on-board computer to collect data and perform triangulation calculations.
